website_summaries.verdict: The best budget rear bike derailleur available for those wanting a small improvement in performance.
pros: Derailleur can survive common scrapes and dents when riding off road or in extreme weather conditions
Long case design provides a greater gear range for larger rear cassettes

customer_reviews.title: Acera Much Better Than Tourney
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Tourney derailler on my Fito Beach Cruiser with the Acera. It's a crank forward bike, and the Tourney really struggled on the upshifts. I noticed when I installed the Acera how much better tension it has than the Tourney, which is why I suspect it works so much better with longer chains that are required for crank forward bikes. The shifts are smooth and solid. This derailler shifts very well under load...do not be afraid to pedal hard with it. I highly recommend this to anyone that still has a Tourney derailler and is suffering from poor shifting.
customer_reviews.author: kratebiker

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Shimano Atlus that broke off my department store-bought bike cos whoever assembled it was a complete ding-dong. I installed it myself this time and was surprised at how easy it was to do it (with help from Google-sensei). Did a few laps around the neighborhood and I didn't encounter any problems with it. Not much difference from the Atlus, but it gets the job done. To those wondering, no, this doesn't come with a separate hanger.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. Very solid.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old XT derailleur that took and bent chain link through it and snapped a bar. Was looking for a replacement and this looked to fit the bill. Easy to install and easy to set up, shifts very well. Using with an SRAM 8-speed chain and, basically, all happy. Very worth the price, great construction for this number of dollars. Don't see any real performance difference, and the spring is nice and tight—no chain slap as I ride around. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PRNLM

customer_reviews.title: Quick change, quiet, efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Had the tourney and wasn't happy with the accuracy. Didn't know much about different models of derailleurs but did my research and heard that these switch quickly and accurately. It was the best quality I could find for a 7 shifter. I put it on, did my adjusting and hopped on. The reviews were true. Rode out to the beach and shifting was quiet and quick. Looking forward to taking it on the trails. I'm currently upgrading a 2009 Diamond back Sorrento (don't laugh) till I can afford a good full suspension. Glad I did my research, shimano all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for the price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Tourney Derailleur with this Acera. My old derailleur was working okay but it looked and felt cheap. The Acera cage seems to be alloy and just looks and functions better. I really like that it connects directly to the frame, unlike my old Tourney that attached with an extension, so it seems to have fewer moving parts to wear out. It was easy to install and adjust and seems shift smoother. I'm not a serious MTB rider, but I do ride every day, so anything that makes for a more pleasant ride is good and I'm really happy with this derailleur.

customer_reviews.title: Not as Advertised....
customer_reviews.text: The product looks nice but the item is advertised as being able to fit a 6 -8 speed hg cassette. Well with every adjustment in the world it would not even come close. I could only get 7 speeds. Also this is not due to lack of knowledge, I have been working on bikes since I was a kid and I'm 35 now. However for the price I paid and for what the product is I decided to keep it and use it for another bike in the future. Not worth returning.

customer_reviews.text: Purchased a bike for my son from Walmart that came with the worlds cheapest deraileuer which he managed to break within a week. I ordered this one as a replacement and it has been much more durable and accurate than the one that he had previously. Although it isn't on par with some higher end components like the ones on my Trek Fuel it is more than adequate for his needs.

product_meta.title: Shimano Acera Mountain Bike Rear Derailleur
product_meta.description:
Compatible with 8-speed HG sprockets, the Shimano Acera RD-410 SGS Rear Derailleur combines style with great value and performance. It's direct-attach and features advanced Shimano technologies, like Advanced Light Action design and low-friction link pivot bushings for crisp, smooth and reliable shifting.

 * Top-normal design offers crisp, clean, derailleur-controlled shifts to hard gears, allowing excellent shifting under heavy load and acceleration -- particularly with RapidFire shifters 
 * Advanced Light Action design for smooth, easy gear changes 
 * Low-friction link pivot bushings provide better shifting response 
 * Oversized 13-tooth pulleys 
 * Aluminum and steel construction for lightweight strength 
 * SGS long cage design offers a wider gear range
